author: Jeffrey Sparshott
title: Real Time Economics: U.S.-China Tensions Easing? | ‘Nowhere Near’ a Nafta Deal | Mortgage Rates Hit 7-Year High - Real Time Economics - WSJ
text: This is the web version of the WSJ’s economic newsletter. You can sign up for daily delivery here. Good morning! Today we look at progress and possibilities for U.S.-China trade relations, “gaping differences” in Nafta talks, President Trump’s pressure on Germany, oil’s latest jump, and the not coincidental rise of U.S. Treasury yields and U.S. mortgage rates. U.S.-CHINA BREAKTHROUGH? Argentina’s Economy Is Near Crisis. Will a Bailout Be Big Enough, Fast Enough? Next Which Jobs Are Workers Most Willing to Move For? These Ones
